website_summaries.verdict: Cotton, padded shin guards with ankle and foot protection for light use in martial arts.
pros: Popular for kickboxing and MMA training
Made from cotton with a fair amount of padding to keep you protected in light sparring
Stay in place with the help of a hook-and-loop strap
cons: Ideal for beginners and for bag work
Not recommended for use in heavier sparring

customer_reviews.title: Good pads
customer_reviews.text: Great buy at a good price I go train Muay Thai and these are very good pads the padding is thick about 3/4 of an inch and the Velcro strap helps secure for the back of the calve the picture I took is about after a month of using them 4 times a week they do slip a little but only from foot pad and I’ve used these in a spar you can’t go wrong with these the design is nice and the quality is much greater than the price
customer_reviews.author: Manuel

customer_reviews.title: Good Pads but Need Adjustments
customer_reviews.text: These are nice pads for sparring and bag work. One size fits all but tag says L. Wished that they were slightly smaller, but that's because I'm pretty short (5' 4"). Pads aren't pre-formed so I placed rubber bands around them to get them to bend around my shin and instep. There's also a lot of spacing between the shin guard and instep guard. Leaves portion of foot open for direct contact. Maybe I'll stitch that part together. Overall, a good buy. If you're short like me and wondering if these will fit, they will. May seem a bit loose, but they stay in place. I haven't had to adjust them at all during sparring.
customer_reviews.author: supernova

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: It is a one size fits all, it does come pretty flat so you have to bend it for while to fit the way you need it. I taped it around some PVC pipe for a few hours to get it to the shape I needed to fit better. I wish I would have gotten these sooner for kickboxing, they really help when kicking the bag.
customer_reviews.author: Falicia

customer_reviews.title: Great bang for your buck, ok durability/protection
customer_reviews.text: I want to first premise that these are definitely a solid bang for your buck. With that being said you definitely get what you pay for. I would recommend these to someone who does light sparring if any sparring at all. If you’re training multiple times throwing/checking hard kicks, these will not properly protect your shins. After a few months of using these, doing Muay Thai 2-3 times a week, I’m upgrading to the Venum Predators as my shins easily bruise up with these. I bought these for $18 and at that value, are a steal. I would say these are a great starter set and stepping stone but if you have sensitive shins, these probably aren’t for you.
customer_reviews.author: danilo micale

customer_reviews.title: Not the most durable
customer_reviews.text: I've had these for about a year, and I don't use them very often. I've worn them maybe a dozen times and the stitching on the heel is already tearing. I'm a person who throws a solid amount of kicks and I don't stumble and put extra stress on the materials. It just doesn't feel like it's made to last. I also don't feel very protected on the arch of the foot. I have high arches, and the material and padding doesn't conform to my foot like I feel it should. I do love the look though.
customer_reviews.author: W. Fong

customer_reviews.title: Fits, but foot pad too big
customer_reviews.text: Female review: My upper calf is 14" with a 15" mid-calf, 12" long shin, 155 lbs. The upper portion fits fine but the foot pad is too wide, bulky, and loose for my 8.5 (women's size) foot. If I had a bigger foot it would be perfect. Still, they're mostly comfortable and definitely light weight. Seems durable.
customer_reviews.author: chelsea

customer_reviews.title: Good for price
customer_reviews.text: When I first got them the shin guards were great for training but as I gradually got better and started hard sparring more I’ve realized these shin guards are not ideal. I should’ve know this since a lot of people already stated this, but a hard check or kicking someone’s knee will go right through the protective layer and give you a nice big bruise. It’s comfortable to wear though and you don’t have to make that many adjustments while sparring but the protection is the issue. So I would recommend it for people just training casually or light sparring but once you start hard sparring I would suggest getting a different pair
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Okay to start with but don’t recommend for sparring.
customer_reviews.text: So I’ve had them for about 7 months now. They’re comfortable, but that’s really it. I definitely don’t recommend these for sparring. There is an opening between the shin and the foot. You will constantly injure yourself when you throw low leg kicks or kicks that get blocked by forearms. Buy something that’s fully protected and that also has side protection. I accidentally kicked an elbow going for a liver kick and it hit right in the opening. Now It’s been swollen and bruised for the past 2 weeks. I know it’s apart of the game but better shin guards would of stopped that from happening.
customer_reviews.author: Victor E.

customer_reviews.title: Good but spend a tiny bit more for better design.
customer_reviews.text: These get the job done if you don't mind occasionally adjusting the pads. I'm considering ordering another set that has the contour to fit the leg better. They're okay, but it seems as though you can spend a little more and get a better design.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Baxley

customer_reviews.title: Not quite what i had hoped for
customer_reviews.text: I was initially looking for an inexpensive easy to wear set of shin guards for training and sparring Muay Thai and came across these. Upon trying them on I decided that the overall shape did not conform well to the shins and the cloth would be to hot during more intense sessions, also I suspect the stitching would probably rip after a while; I returned them the same day and had no issues with return/refund. Overall I like Venum products for Muay Thai and MMA but in this case I would recommend spending extra to go with some of their higher end shin guards.
customer_reviews.author: Will S.

customer_reviews.title: Not for heavy sparring
customer_reviews.text: The padding is very minimal and weak for the sparring that I do. I'm getting a lot of bruising under the pad. If you do heavy sparring this is not the product. Also the pullover design almost did not fit my legs. For a light spar or kicking soft surfaces it's just enough pad. I wouldn't recommend this to people though.
customer_reviews.author: Ginah

customer_reviews.title: Love these!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair, first ones were put through the rounds with everyone in the gym. Only thing is the padding over the foot is a little long. Mine were stepped on a few times, a feeling that resembles having a flat tire. But I bought them again because they really absorb impact well, without being too bulky that slows movement.
customer_reviews.author: Junior loya

customer_reviews.title: Too big
customer_reviews.text: Too big and flat. These did not curve around my shin - just looked like I was wearing flat boards.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Light weight, comfortable, padded well for the price.
customer_reviews.text: When I bought these chin guards I had just started doing muay thai. I thought they looked pretty cool and simple as you just slip them on. Though they are simple to put on, taking them off after a sweaty session is not as simple, so be prepared for that. They are very light, you dont really feel weighed down at all. And I they protect you pretty well and when I spar my opponents say it's pretty well padded. I've had it for 5 months and the padding on top of the foot has started to bend sideways, still works perfectly fine.
customer_reviews.author: Tarek E.

customer_reviews.title: Great when worn properly!
customer_reviews.text: These are awesome so far. Fit well if you pull them all the way up. I need to clean them so I may adjust this review! However no complaints. When brand new you have to wear them a while to break them in and I recommend wearing under gear to take most of your sweat! If you have very large calves you may not like em!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: I know for a fact that there are better products than this one. However, I feel people get their money's worth with these Sshinguards ad they get the job done. They work great for light sparing and partner drills.
customer_reviews.author: Jorge Moreno

customer_reviews.title: Tight Fit, decent guards
customer_reviews.text: Love Venum brand, these are less padded than my previous ones where the velcro snapped. I am 220 and these fit very very tight in their largest or one sit fits all size.
customer_reviews.author: Foster

customer_reviews.title: Good for beginners or not heavy or advanced moves. Great quality
customer_reviews.text: I wear these for mixed martial arts class. Since I’m a beginner they work. Sometimes they are a little of a pain to get off but overall I’m very happy. Since I’m only doing bag and not taking hard hits from others they provide enough protection. I even wear for the conditioning exercises because it would be too much hassle to take on and off.
customer_reviews.author: Kris

customer_reviews.title: Good fit around the shin, poor at the foot. Light sparring only
customer_reviews.text: The shin fits perfectly but the foot guard is very uncomfortable (I'm 1.75m tall, size 43 EU and 30 cm shin length). Also, quality feels poor. These are obviously guards for light sparring, which is fine, but there are already stitches sticking out and I just got them.. Will update further after and session.
customer_reviews.author: Arthur Sap

customer_reviews.title: So cute and fit great (ever shorter people!)
customer_reviews.text: My tall 11 y-o (5' 2") loves these (for muay thai) - they fit great (solid over 100lbs body) and she loves the neon pink. I read reviews, that people about 5' 7" love them and think might be too large for shorter folks - but they work well on my 5' 2" kid.
customer_reviews.author: Justanotherbuyer

customer_reviews.title: Good for kicking the bag. Look good and feel good.
customer_reviews.text: They seem pretty good and feel really good. They def don't seem as cheap as they are. Not sure about the long run but there's no loose stitching or funky fit. They're a little stiff at first but no big deal. Not sure how good they would be for sparring but kicking the back they work well. They look pretty good too.
customer_reviews.author: Zachary Woodside

customer_reviews.title: They will shift slightly
customer_reviews.text: They are good for bag work i like how they just slip on but they will shift slightly but I'm not using them for sparing so it's all good.
customer_reviews.author: Michigan outdoorsman

customer_reviews.title: Know what you're buying first before complaining
customer_reviews.text: Do your research first before purchasing... it's easy. Ofcourse these aren't made for hard sparring. Kick the Thai bag alot more and numb them shins up, people
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: great deal
customer_reviews.text: this pair should be used for either sparring or competing, but not both. i don't have any wear and tear but i can tell if used for both sparring and competing it might not last more than a year and a half tops. the pair is very comfortable and easy to put on
customer_reviews.author: Carlos

customer_reviews.title: Good for light weight lite sparring. Not for heavy weights like me.
customer_reviews.text: The foothold rolls up under my feet and it's distracting. The padding is a little shy of protection for heavy weights like me. I have taken punishment from leg kicks and tripped backwards because of the footholds as well.
customer_reviews.author: Sudan

customer_reviews.title: Not good at all.
customer_reviews.text: Unlike the Gloves, these shin guards are very low quality. You are better off getting the Sanabaul brand.
customer_reviews.author: Boris Koblents

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: Gets really hot compared to my other shin gaurds I've had. These offer very little protection. I wouldn't recommend it for any full contact sparring. But i guess its ok for a < $30 shin gaurd. Plus i hate these kinds of shin guards that go on like socks. It's just a pet peeve of mine i guess.
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: after using them I had bad bruises all over
customer_reviews.text: they are not protecting at all, after using them I had bad bruises all over: I'll go back using my old instep guards while looking for new ones
customer_reviews.author: .liv.

customer_reviews.title: No more busted shins
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put on . Great protection. Getting shin blasted is no fun. Have had these in some pretty brutal matches thus far and no shin damage. Usually the first place I get hit being blocked
customer_reviews.author: Kane

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Quick and easy to put on and take off. Full coverage of shins and top of foot
customer_reviews.author: Lindyloowho

customer_reviews.title: Good, leaves foot a little unprotected
customer_reviews.text: The foot cover slips a bit and doesn't cover as much of the foot as I would like. You can still really feel it if you accidentally make contact with the foot. But overall a solid shin guard for light protection -- you can still feel a lot of impact through it, but I use it to get myself ready for MMA where shin protection isn't allowed.
customer_reviews.author: Tarah K.

customer_reviews.title: Arrived Smelling Like Ammonia
customer_reviews.text: The product seems to work well for it's purpose, EXCEPT that it arrived in it's plastic packaging damp and smelling like ammonia. I can't imagine that's normal. It was gross. I left packaging feedback, but received no communication from the seller.
customer_reviews.author: Robert O'Donnell

customer_reviews.title: Good for beginners.
customer_reviews.text: They're cheap but the padding is very thing. I've been pretty badly hurt because I was cheap and didn't want to invest in quality shin gaurds. They're good for beginners who don't spar hard. But not for advanced sparring.
customer_reviews.author: L.K.

customer_reviews.title: Great starting shin guards
customer_reviews.text: Great starting shin guards. Shipped around, but before I bought any of the fancy ones I decided to really pay attention to what people at the gym had. Everyone had these. Got them, they're not too thick to prevent a little bit of healthy shin conditioning when hitting the bag/light sparring. If you're sparring heavy, maybe move up.
customer_reviews.author: Trevor C.

customer_reviews.title: If you plan on training for a long while, ...
customer_reviews.text: If you plan on training for a long while, invest in a thicker pad with open/strapped back. These are just too damn much of a struggle to get off of sweaty legs and you will leave some bruises on your partner if your even half decent at giving a kick
customer_reviews.author: C. Evans

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: These have been great. Throw them in the washer and air dry
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: If he's happy I'm
customer_reviews.text: My little brother had no complaints with his training, in fact he asked for more products from this manufacture. If he's happy I'm happy
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: They are ok
customer_reviews.text: Fit kinda tight, don’t feel like they will last a very long time. Only used them twice so far but not as qualtity as the more expensive ones
customer_reviews.author: Cameron Stoutster27

customer_reviews.title: True to size. Fast delivery.
customer_reviews.text: Great brand! True to size, my son recently started kickboxing and these worked out great.
customer_reviews.author: tammy k

customer_reviews.title: Soft and practical.
customer_reviews.text: I have been using them 12 times per month for my Muay Thai classes and I am very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Daniela

customer_reviews.title: These are awesome for training for an upcoming mma or Muay Thai ...
customer_reviews.text: These are awesome for training for an upcoming mma or Muay Thai fight to condition shins with decent padding but not too thick. Stay in place well and don't twist. If they twist that means you are kicking incorrectly and should adjust your kick. (Twist those hips more baby)
customer_reviews.author: jkruger85

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: Not bad. Not great. They’re tough and great for kicking the bag after I’ve already made my shins sore but they spin and have to be readjusted often. Not bad for the price but most Venum products exceed expectations.
customer_reviews.author: tyler dockery

customer_reviews.title: Great for kickboxing/Muay Thai
customer_reviews.text: I love these shinguards. They are lightweight, but protective--great for kickboxing/Muay Thai practice. A little hard to get off once your calves are sweaty, but they don't shift during practice.
customer_reviews.author: Kait M.

customer_reviews.title: Great for light sparring.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for a starter kit. Does what it’s needed to do. Pads are not removable.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Magana

customer_reviews.title: These are ok.
customer_reviews.text: These are ok, I got these for my 12 year old son who is in mma classes. They fit ok, but the back strap is kind of uncomfortable he said, but he still wears them. They are fine for his level of use but I think if he goes higher he will need better protection.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. ChaCha

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: Great for Thai boxing. My training is not extremely brutal so this one does the job. Wortg it and would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Lory Tip

customer_reviews.title: Sparring with Venum
customer_reviews.text: one of best purchases for my training thus far. great comfort and fantastic protection for sparring. Provides protection agains some of my younger and more aggressive sparring partners.
customer_reviews.author: Madwyck

customer_reviews.title: Great product for an unbelievably low price!
customer_reviews.text: I have been using these for sparring, and 2 amateur MMA matches and they are surprisingly protective. The thing that I like most is that I don't have to stop everytime I kick like my other guards with the metal buckle and open calf area. I highly suggest these!
customer_reviews.author: Carl Prescott

customer_reviews.title: Pain to take off
customer_reviews.text: Real thin and a pain to take off. I’ve had them for a month now with daily use. I just upgraded to different brand with rear straps. I’m 300 lbs so my kicks are hard and these pads just a little.
customer_reviews.author: Viridiana Barriga

customer_reviews.title: It's excellent for what it is
customer_reviews.text: Just be aware this isn't your top tier of protection. It's excellent for what it is, but training partners may be wary as there are shin pads that offer much more protection. Basically everyone I've sparred with has more padding, but I haven't been hurt through these in my first week using them.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: i gave as gift and they slip off a little, not a lot of protection.
customer_reviews.author: Shell70

customer_reviews.title: They did well and work fine but the outer material isn't very strong
customer_reviews.text: They did well and work fine but the outer material isn't very strong. I did ten rounds on the bag and the entire toe of one pad was frayyed. It's now falling apart.
customer_reviews.author: Dana Whitman

customer_reviews.title: Great for kicking
customer_reviews.text: Fit as expected, pull on and off just like shin guards for soccer. Come in several color patterns.
customer_reviews.author: April

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: These fit great and keep my shins and feet safe when I’m hitting the heavy bag.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn Rivera

customer_reviews.title: terrible
customer_reviews.text: returned. this is kids size and offers no protection. order the sanabul ones
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Great pads at a great price point!!
customer_reviews.text: They work better then expected for the price. I use them for muay thai style kick boxing/sparring and they feel good and hold up great for what you pay.
customer_reviews.author: Anna&Bobby

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Not bad for what u pay for, and they look bad ass
customer_reviews.author: ivan

customer_reviews.title: Great feel and great shin protection
customer_reviews.text: Great feel and great shin protection. Movement is sometimes difficult but they're not meant for people to walk in them constantly. Overall amazing pads. I use them in Muay Thai and MMA fights. I've never used anything better.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny Nichols

customer_reviews.title: Nice pads good for light sparing
customer_reviews.text: Nice pads good for light sparing. not the best if you are constantly checking kicks, I have a bad habit of absorbing with my shin then counter striking. good product will buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Guyen Miller

customer_reviews.title: These are nice shin guards for the price
customer_reviews.text: These are nice shin guards for the price. I do recommend to consider investing in higher quality guards if you check kicks or get kicked frequently during sparing. After a few kicks and checks you will feel it pretty good. But these are still good for light and moderate sparing.
customer_reviews.author: Fan

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Nice and light doesn't even feel like i have shin pads on .....I had to wear them for about to practices straight to get them to form though but all and all good product
customer_reviews.author: Ryan armele

customer_reviews.title: Great guards.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome product. I was doubtful whether these will work or not but these work GREAT for my sparring/myui thai class. It does not move for the half non-stop hour that I practice. For a 5 6' guy these do a very good job at protecting shins and feet.
customer_reviews.author: P. Sood

customer_reviews.title: Ok but not the best quality.
customer_reviews.text: Got these for my kids who are in MMA. They are ok but not the best. Padding is thin and they both unraveled around the top opening after a month or so. Now I have to spend money to buy a better set. Spend the extra money and get a better quality of pads.
customer_reviews.author: A. Wall

customer_reviews.title: Great for beginners and training
customer_reviews.text: Learned the hard way that you need shin protection. These are great for sparing or hitting a bag.
customer_reviews.author: Don@Amazon

customer_reviews.title: Most good.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent guards. Stay in place, look awesome, and protect well. Little stiff at first but thats how it should be. Very happy!
customer_reviews.author: Marcus Halvorsen

customer_reviews.title: They are comfortable for sparring however
customer_reviews.text: They are comfortable for sparring however, try not to go too hard with kicks. Its going to hurt after a while lol. They are a good buy in my opinion
customer_reviews.author: FernandoZ

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Shinguard
customer_reviews.text: Comfort fit. Very good shin guards. I love that they fit snug and does g slide. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Jermaine Wright

customer_reviews.title: good value
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use, takes a little molding to perfectly fits but its a good product for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Pong Chiu Sing

customer_reviews.title: Do their job
customer_reviews.text: Got these and at first thought about the very stiff pads, but of course over time they got softer. I'm pretty sure they're not Gel, just a cheap Foam because it doesn't feel like a gel at all, just like a stiff foam. They are showing signs of wear and tear but nothing too serious... 4/5 because they're nothing special.
customer_reviews.author: Jose luis

customer_reviews.title: size
customer_reviews.text: are you crazy ? the large for me is to much smoller i am 180 cm or 590 foot i dident back this becouse i did gift it to a kid 8 years old.
customer_reviews.author: Vicente

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: looks very nice, fit well, but in some parts the fabric is a little delicate
customer_reviews.author: Glayjos G

customer_reviews.title: Good for headkicks
customer_reviews.text: Nice and light, good for mobility because they are soo light weight
customer_reviews.author: Alexander Smith

customer_reviews.title: ... SON WAS SO EXCITED TO GET THESE IT WAS LIKE WATCHING A LITTLE KID ON CHRISTMAS
customer_reviews.text: MY SON WAS SO EXCITED TO GET THESE IT WAS LIKE WATCHING A LITTLE KID ON CHRISTMAS.
customer_reviews.author: GOLDEN 1

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great protection for sparring in kickboxing and for bag work. Beginner and intermediate use. Love
customer_reviews.author: Firecracker

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good for hitting bags but questionable for sparring. For the price it's worth at least giving a try.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: these replaced my other shin guards made by century that accidently walked away
customer_reviews.author: m. smith

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality
customer_reviews.text: My son loves these. He wears them everyday at the gym. They hold up great. Just need to know how to get rid of the stinky smelly teen boy smell! LOL!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: very Impressed
customer_reviews.text: im a Indy pro wrestler and these are very comfortable and i recommend this for anyone that likes kickpads for martial arts or pro wrestling.
customer_reviews.author: ray

customer_reviews.title: Serves my purpose just fine.
customer_reviews.text: I take a Jiu jitsu / boot camp class several days a week. These work great at bruise prevention.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa S.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: the only book you need is the zhuang zi and tai chi or chi kung practice
customer_reviews.author: Alexei Goncharenko

customer_reviews.title: great product for a reasonable cost
customer_reviews.text: I cannot be more satisfied with my shin guards! I have used them for light training and they work perfectly! they fabric is very durable and they don't move regarding how long you practice. very comfortable and bad ass looking! definitely I would recommend them! They are just awesome for what I paid for them!
customer_reviews.author: ROMMEL MOISES ROSALES

customer_reviews.title: Great for MMA
customer_reviews.text: These have been absolutely amazing! They've been through the ringer. And saved my shins from many bruises.
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: Stretches out
customer_reviews.text: It seems like it stretches out easily but otherwise, it is pretty good.
customer_reviews.author: good game to try

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic product. It is exactly as described. It arrived quickly and works great for sparring.
customer_reviews.author: M & C Ingram

customer_reviews.title: i like them better than the ones that go over the ...
customer_reviews.text: they dont slip and i've had no issues using them. i like them better than the ones that go over the shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Marques

customer_reviews.title: It’s a good product, not for serious training
customer_reviews.text: Great for light sparring but if your upping intensity with sparring get something with more firm padding
customer_reviews.author: CCollins

customer_reviews.title: Great item for price
customer_reviews.text: I like it. It's a great item. I haven't checked but I would like for them to make one to wear when you have shoes on.
customer_reviews.author: Denzel Pereira

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: These are awesome i have 2 pairs i love and use all the time.
customer_reviews.author: johanna negrete

customer_reviews.title: Great deal for bag work
customer_reviews.text: This review is months after ordering. The guards worked as advertised, really took the sting out of kicking sand packs in the heavy bag. They fit well and comfortably. 10,000 kicks later the elastic is starting to stretch and the pads are shifting on legs, nothing a 5 second pause can't put back in place. Would/will order again.
customer_reviews.author: Joey Babin

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: They are very light, These are ok for a punching bag, when sparring you do feel the contact!
customer_reviews.author: Enrique

customer_reviews.title: Definitely worth it
customer_reviews.text: Light weight, pad molded to my shin my only concern is im not sure how to clean it
customer_reviews.author: Caitlin o.

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable and easy to put on! They work. Very well with contact during sparring matches.
customer_reviews.author: Paige Moore

customer_reviews.title: An uneven fit
customer_reviews.text: One of them fits me good the other one not so much
customer_reviews.author: Omar Hidalgo

customer_reviews.title: Spent more on quality
customer_reviews.text: Your better of paying more for more protection. There’s shin pads are ok if you aren’t making much contact
customer_reviews.author: Richard Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Good pads for the casual trainer
customer_reviews.text: These are very comfortable and stay put (I rarely had to adjust them while training.) However, these guards are for light training and not really hard enough for regular sparring. These work great when working pads and light training but do not provide adequate protection when heavy sparring. I recommend these for your light training but think you will need heavier duty guards for when you get down and dirty. The vendor "Price Fighter" shipped quick and was responsive.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Ruby Built The Pyramids

customer_reviews.title: works good for me
customer_reviews.text: I got a pair of these for my muay Thai training, works good for me. They stay in place pretty good and the protection is fairly good for light sparing.
customer_reviews.author: J F

customer_reviews.title: these are great for light muy thai sparring
customer_reviews.text: these are great for light muy thai sparring. no issues, and seem pretty sturdy for the weekend warrior like me.
customer_reviews.author: Danny V.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Wicked fast shipping and my Daughter, yes my daughter, is loving them. LOL! The next Rhonda Rousey!
customer_reviews.author: Lionel W. Gibbons

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: A bit annoying to get on and off. Otherwise, definitely does the job.
customer_reviews.author: jeff conley

customer_reviews.title: Too thin for shin guards
customer_reviews.text: They were too thin. Hurt to kick and block kicks.

product_meta.title: Venum "Kontact" Shin and Instep Guards
product_meta.description: The Kontact shin guards are an essential tool for Mixed Martial Arts or Kickboxing. Striking with your shins during sparring can be dangerous for you and/or your partner if you don't use protective shin guards. Use your full striking arsenal with peace of mind with these Venum shin guards.
feature_bullets: Velcro closure for a customized no-slip fit
